meanings.sent1: She floundered in the deep snow, unable to move forward.
meanings.sent2: The puppy floundered around the room, bumping into furniture.
meanings.sent3: The clown floundered comically on the slippery floor, trying to juggle.
meanings.sent4: His attempts to dance gracefully floundered like a fish out of water.
meanings.sent5: The lost hiker floundered in the dense forest, searching for a way out.

meanings.sent1: The injured bird floundered on the ground, unable to fly.
meanings.sent2: The toddler floundered across the room, still learning to walk.
meanings.sent3: The robot floundered through the maze, bumping into walls.
meanings.sent4: The old car floundered up the steep hill, struggling with each turn.
meanings.sent5: The tired swimmer floundered in the pool, barely making progress.

meanings.sent1: The business floundered after the economic downturn.
meanings.sent2: His confidence floundered when he forgot his lines on stage.
meanings.sent3: The cake floundered in the oven, turning out burnt and inedible.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship floundered under the weight of constant arguments.
meanings.sent5: The team's morale floundered after losing the championship game.
